comment.author: 66311327@N05
comment._content: Helena Paderewski was the wife of the pianist and later second Prime Minister of the Republic of Poland Ignacy Jan Paderewski. pl.wikipedia.org/wiki/Helena_Paderewska (polish) en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ignacy_Jan_Paderewski She sold her collection of dolls in order to maintain the Relief Fund for Polish War Victims (The Pittsburgh Press, January 9, 1916 news.google.com/newspapers?nid=1144&dat=19160109&...) “Madame Paderewski while in Paris late in 1915 conceived the idea of selling dolls for the benefit of the Polish Relief Fund. These wonderful dolls are made by the Polish refugees in Paris — artists, sculptors, writers — all people of talent and many of them well-known ; by engaging them to make the dolls Madame Paderewski has not only been able to provide support for these gifted workers, but she has been able to raise in this way more than $25,000, having sold about 10,000 dolls. “ (quotation from www.ebooksread.com/authors-eng/ida-clyde-gallagher-clarke...)
